blockReduce

public void blockReduce(StructureHandler handler,
                        int count,
                        APattern pattern,
                        int startInputRecordIndex)
Description copied from interface: StackHandler
It is used for certain compositors that use block handling for their children and all the occurrences are reduced at the end. It shifts every occurrence one by one, setting every time the StructureHandler corresponding to the pattern.

Specified by:
blockReduce in interface StackHandler

limitReduce

public void limitReduce(StructureHandler handler,
                        int MIN,
                        int MAX,
                        APattern pattern,
                        int startInputRecordIndex)
Description copied from interface: StackHandler
It is used for certain compositors that use limit handling for their children and all the occurrences are reduced at the end. It shifts every occurrence one by one, setting every time the StructureHandler corresponding to the pattern. It is not fully implemented and it stops shifting after MIN. This means that in case the pattern needs to be shifted on a MInterleaveHandler this will throw an UnsupportedOperationException error because here it not shifting all the occurrences might introduce errors.

Specified by:
limitReduce in interface StackHandler

endValidation

public void endValidation()
Description copied from interface: StackHandler
Used by the EventHandler when there is no more input for this stack to trigger the validation of the context. Unlike during the rest of the handling, this method makes it possible to reduce StructureHandlers that are not active. During the execution of this method missing content errors are determined.

Specified by:
endValidation in interface StackHandler

endSubtreeValidation

public void endSubtreeValidation(StructureHandler handler)
Description copied from interface: StackHandler
Used when a subtree of the StructureHandler tree handled by this StackHandler must be reduced. The argument represents the top of the subtree and it must be an active StructureHandler. During the execution of the method it is possible to reduce handlers that are not active. Missing content errors in the concerned subtree are determined.

Specified by:
endSubtreeValidation in interface StackHandler

setAsCurrentHandler

public void setAsCurrentHandler(StructureHandler sh)
Description copied from interface: StackHandler
To be called from deactivate when the current handler must not be ended before another one can start, that is in the context of an interleave, called from StructureDoubleHandlers or from GroupHandler.

Specified by:
setAsCurrentHandler in interface StackHandler
